title: Police officers caught for bribing motorist
text:
Two Philadelphia police officers appeared in the Atlantis magistrate’s court on Wednesday 7 August on a charge of corruption after they allegedly solicited a bribe from a motorist.

The police officers, a 35-year-old Sergeant and 37-year-old Constable, allegedly pulled over a vehicle on the N7 near Philadelphia on 14 July at about 01:00. They allegedly solicited the driver to pay R400 to avoid arrest for driving under the influence of alcohol, said Captain FC van Wyk, provincial spokesperson of the police. After paying the money, the driver was allowed to go, Van Wyk said.

The driver reported the matter to the police and the two police officers were identified and arrested by members of the anti-corruption unit on Tuesday 6 August at the Philadelphia Police Station.

Although the names of the suspects may be published after court appearance, the Philadelphia Police Station and Atlantis magistrate’s court were tight-lipped about their identity. TygerBurger was told by a representative of Atlantis magistrate’s court that they were specifically instructed on the day of the court appearance not to put media enquiries through to the clerks of the court.
